name: Wyman Hotel and Inn (The)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time in Silverton. We have stayed at the Wyman before and the gentleman that owns the place now is very nice. The folks that work for the Wyman are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place could use a little updating especially in the bathrooms. I prefer white linens on all beds and in all baths but the colored ones that were in our room were fine. The breakfast was great and we will stay there again .
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 7 nights during the first week of Aug 2012. The Wyman is a lovely hotel, beautifully restored, clean and well maintained. We truly enjoyed getting to know the owners, Rodger and Tana Wrubilk - they take a personal interest in their guests and strive to provide the best service possible. Their breakfasts are not your run of the mill hotel breakfasts - Rodger and Tana put on a full 'french cuisine' breakfast in a beautifully appointed side-room. They also have a wine & hors d'ouvers / tea & snacks reception each afternoon in the lobby at 5pm. It's a great time to socialize with the other guests, get to know people and generally relax. Rodger and Tana also have all the menus from the town's restaraunts and can give you advice depending on what you want to eat.
reviews.title: Great Silverton B&B

reviews.text: We will definitely return to the Wyman, it was a memorable and wonderful experience for us!
reviews.title: Authentic setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not normally a B&B guy but so glad my wife picked this place for our stay in Silverton. The little touches and the service are amazing. Like staying at grandma's house. Splurge a little and check it out.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The Wyman is a genuinely welcoming little hotel. The staff are all friendly and eager to make you feel a part of the place. The breakfast is excellent and varies from day to day. The views from the second story rooms are also worth seeking out.
reviews.title: Warm hospitality, Cold Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That being said, while we weren't expecting Aspen's Hotel Jerome or Telluride's New Sheridan, we were expecting adequately heated rooms. When we arrived the rooms were all a brisk 58 F; by the time we left a couple of days later, they had warmed up to a not exactly cozy 62 F. The good down duvets in each room provide a comfortable sleeping temperature, but make sure your thermal layers are next to the bed when you want to get up. If you're a skier, also avoid the invitation to use their boot drying room; we were greeted with soggy boots the next morning. Bring your own boot dryers. And you never know: they may even have the added benefit of warming up the room a touch.
reviews.title: Incredible hotel and service from management and staff

reviews.text: The room decoration tends toward the "more is more" school of bed and breakfast design. Some will find this quaint, others may come down with an acute case of kitsch overload. No one, however, probably books the Wyman for a minimalist boutique hotel experience, and while I've only given it 3 stars, it is the best place to stay in Silverton.
reviews.title: A hotel with the true character and charm of the west

reviews.text: We arrived in March fleeing our devastating New Mexico juniper allergies. In addition we were exhausted and my bad foot was acted up.
reviews.title: Had A Great Experience

reviews.text: Management and staff were incredible. Breakfast in our room that first day -- ultrasound and infrared heat for my foot. We never detected a hint that we were pains in the neck -- although I undoubtedly was.
reviews.title: Cool place to stay in old Silverton

reviews.text: Had a very nice stay at the Wyman, the owners are very helpful and super nice. Great sitting room \Lobby with nice chairs and a stove to warm up at when you walk in, In fact the Front desk is a antique and a focal point of the room. Our room 10, had two queen beds with Feather toppers, warm comforters, antiques etc. The whole hotel is a antique, cool windows, uneven floors, high ceilings, beautiful stairway, sitting areas. If you live in a box stay away, you w'ont like walking up the stairs, or even chilling or playing chess in one of the sitting areas. Silverton is a Cool town, good shopping, Eating, Drinking, and can walk anywhere. Winter activity, skating, sledding, Extreme Skiing at Silverton Mtn. Family Skiing at Ski Kendall. The owner Roger can set you up with gear, ski Rental shop at hotel.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay in Silverton

Lovely B&B
reviews.text: Stayed here 2 nights in mid-September while enjoying the changing of the leaves in the San Juan forest. The Inn was clean, cozy and oozing charm, the hosts and staff were friendly and helpful, for the most part. The bathroom was tiny and cramped in the room I stayed in, but it was a retrofit for an antique hotel, so that is understandable. I would like to try a bigger room on my next stay, and there will definitely be a next stay! Internet did not work for most of my stay.

The hotel is in a great city.the service here is amazing,the rooms are very special and the building that the hotel is in is from 1902.the location is in the middle of the city.the rooms are very clean and the value of the rooms is very good!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!!!
Magical Inn
reviews.text: Im highly recommend it!

Had the pleasure of spending two nights in the lovely "winter doe room" for my brother's wedding. The owner's were most attentive and eager to please. The breakfast was fabulous - a rich, buttery quiche one morning and raspberry french toast the next. The room was very clean and quiet....very authentic and yet I had wi-fi and direct tv. I look forward to returning sometime in the future.
reviews.title: Cozy, historical inn with really good customer service and charm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rode the DSNGRR up to Silverton and stayed the night at this charming inn. The staff was very attentive and the extra special touches really added to our great experience. The complimentary bike rental, delicious evening snacks and wonderful breakfast the next morning topped off a great stay! I am so glad we found this Silverton gem.
reviews.title: Pretty room

description: This Hotel & Inn was built in 1902. We provide just the right blend of modern amenities and still maintain the Victorian decor one would expect in a hotel in Silverton,Colorado. One of our special rooms is an authentic caboose situated in a large patio area that is just right for honeymooners and those celebrating an anniversary. Our property staff is eager to make your vacation in the beautiful San Juan Mountains a vacation to remember. We hope you will consider a stay at our beautiful Hotel.
